thread.title: Valentine Holmes fit Sharks v Cowboys NRL Finals clash | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: Valentine Holmes fit for Sharks v Cowboys NRL Finals clash | DailyTelegraph

author: dailytelegraph.com
title: Valentine Holmes fit Sharks v Cowboys NRL Finals clash | DailyTelegraph
text:
RISING star Valentine Holmes has declared himself a certain starter for Cronulla’s elimination final with North Queensland in Townsville. The Sharks leading tryscorer this season suffered a heavy cork above his knee in the opening minute of Cronulla’s emphatic elimination final victory over South Sydney last Sunday.
PREDICTIONS: Matty Johns Finals tips and analysis
Other Stories Abbott’s last party at Kirribilli National 0 comments 00-heaven: Joey dating Bond’s ex Sydney Confidential 0 comments Cummins is Roosters’ worst nightmare Nrl 0 comments How Aussie died in Bali hotel room World The dirty side of Hayne’s 49ers job More Sports 0 comments ‘I went into shock’: Lana’s tears Television 0 comments FINALS: Robson steadying role alongside finals rookie Bird
SUPPORT: Wheeler sings Sharks team song from hospital bed
Producing a total of just three runs for 52-metres, Holmes was virtually a passenger as he attempted to fight through the pain before finally succumbing to the injury in the 50th minute.
However, after commencing the week undergoing scans to assess the severity of the damage, Holmes showed no sign of stress or soreness as he sizzled through the Sharks final captain’s run this morning at Remondis Stadium. News_Image_File: Valentine Holmes is fighting fit and raring to go in Townsville
“I felt good at training today and I’m ready to go in Townsville tomorrow night,” Holmes said. “I’ve worked hard with the medical staff here at the Sharks this week and they’re happy with the way the injury has recovered.
“I’m relieved it has responded as well as it has and I’m really looking forward to playing a big game back in my home town.”
Such was the confidence from coach Shane Flanagan that the 20-year-old winger would be passed fit to play, regular shadow players Blake Ayshford and Mitch Brown, were not even called to be part of the final session.
The Sharks travelled on their team bus to Sydney airport immediately after their last hitout and will arrive in enemy territory of Townsville this afternoon.
 Holmes relishing big stage clash with Sharks
